intro: Pourthiaea benthamiana var. salicifolia, commonly known as the Salicifolia benthamiana, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and generally herbaceous growth habit. The leaves are lanceolate, with a distinctive silvery-green coloration due to dense pubescence, and the plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in compact clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
